newsitem.title: USA: Anadarko big bidder on deepwater leases.
newsitem.headline: Anadarko big bidder on deepwater leases.

text.p: Anadarko Petroleum Corp said it moved into deepwater exploration in the Gulf of Mexico at Wednesday's federal sale of ounter continental shelf leases.
The company, acting alone or with partners, was the apparent high bidder on 12 of 14 total tracts sought, it said.
The blocks, in water depths ranging from 2,700-to-5,700 feet, represent spending of $2.35 million net to Anadarko.
"This lease sale marked our entrance into the deepwater play, a frontier area in the Gulf of Mexico" said chief executive Robert J. Allison Jr.

The company said it was joined equally by Louisiana Land and Exploration Co and Mariner Energy Inc in bids on three East Breaks blocks. On two Garden Banks bids Vastar Resources Inc has a 50 percent interest while Anadarko and LL&E have 25 percent each.
Anadarko said it made successful 100 percent bids on Alaminos Canyon Blocks 82 and 126 and had a 75 percent stake in five other Alaminos Canyon bids, while LL&E put up the other 25 percent.
